one_reviews_text:
...of being one of the best games/sports activities on the Quest platform.
This game is one of my favorites, I gladly play it for 15-20 min. any time. However there are sooo many ways the developer could enhance the experience to make this game perfect.

- the single player mode is boring. You simply beat the opponents, maybe replay some matches to get all 3 stars from every robot, but that's it. It would be so easy to spice up things with an achievement system: Beat an opponent without mistakes, beat an opponent with only power shots, etc. Just take a look at In Death: Unchained.

- The unlockable gear dull. A variety of rackets would be a nice addition, and more options in general would make the game more colorful. Just take a look at Blaston.

- No sfx for the single player opponents at all. Ok, this would surely annoy someone, but this could be an option in the menu. In my opinion this would enhance the immersion so much.

- The motion capture of the robots are very amateur in some cases. For example you can see that the floating robot "walks" without having legs.

- More enviroments would be a nice addition.

- The gained xp is not scaling with better performance. You make 9 mistakes or zero, you get the same.

- Leader boards, monthly events would be nice too.

Anyways, I still love this game, will play it, but it would be soo good to see it improve over time like other games do.

When it comes to VR table tennis, I reviewed Eleven as "the best one" but this one is definitely "the fun one". The physics here aren't quite realistic, but they're so close that it still feels right, yet it's tweaked just enough that you won't get quite as frustrated as with a more realistic simulator. These two main VR table tennis games really represent two sides of the same coin, and they're very hard to choose between. If you have the money and love table tennis, just get both. If you want a more arcade experience while still feeling realistic, this is your game. If you want something so real that it might actually help your real-life table tennis skills, try the other one.

I like the mechanics of this game alot and the gameplay, however i have run into a very serious problem. For all my friends the rankings are displayed on the screen and go up and down after playing a match. However this is not the case for me, my ranking does not go up or down or even display on my screen. I grinded this game for a decent bit and got all the way to semi pro III but i wanted to see my ranking so I thought uninstalling and re installing may fix the issue, however all it did was ERASE my charachter and reset me to a rookie i lost everything and STILL cant see my ranking after all of this.

review_title: Great game, but could be better
one_reviews_text: This was the first game installed after I bought my VR headset. Prior  I watched the gameplay and I was certain that this game is a must for table tennis fans. Great experience in single player mode, practice or competition.   A big disappointment though in multiplayer. Table tennis is a game for two players and the multiplayer experience is very important. That is why I no longer play this table tennis game but another one. If the multiplayer mode would be improved this game would be a winner.

review_title: Must have for ping pong lovers!
one_reviews_text: Best ping pong game I've ever played in VR physics and the whole experience is amazing devs keep updating the game have had lots of hours into the game and keep coming back!!

I like this game, the physics are pretty cool and the scifi setting makes it more interesting. Bought it mainly because of the single player mode and I wasn't able to have fun at all. Playing vs the IA its so unfair it becomes frustrating, the first levels are way too easy and when you rank up you face IA's that feel all the same to me and that make you realise that you are playing vs a machine. It feels like the IA decides wich points you win or lose before the point starts. It doesn't matter if your shot was good at all, if the IA decides that you lose this one, you will no matter how good your shots are. I understand making IA's its a pretty hard thing to do, but this one doesn't react to the player performance, it makes a winner you can't react to or misses, thats all.

If you are reading this you are probably asking yourself which VR table tennis is the best available right now. The answer might disappoint you but it depends on what you are looking for.
 
This game looks polished at first, with nice graphics/good physics and everything. 

Then you start noticing that something isn't quite right:

Simulation seems real a first, but then you notice that it is NOT as accurate as that of Eleven (the other VR table tennis game used as obvious comparison). Personally I am looking for maximum realism for  table tennis games so this for me is a very important point.

For this game multiplayer takes ages to find an opponent and when it does it lags so much that it is unplayable. My experience has been poor so far. On the contrary eleven is much much better and has a very nice community.

Single player is quite nice and it is better than Eleven in my view, as there is a sort of championship against AI which is challenging enough. Also i like the sense of progression when you unlock new skins for your robot. In Eleven there is just a minimum customisation. Also the number of lighting/environments is better in this game than in Eleven.

I have a beefy PC but i am also experiencing serious performance problems like massive framerate drops...but i get that with Eleven sometimes, so it is a tie here.

Now, if you just want to play/practice against AI, then this game is absolutely fine, but if you want a better multiplayer experience or a more realistic physics then go for Eleven. 

Note that if you decide to own both (like i did) you will notice that when you will get more skilled at one of the two, somehow the skill is not transferrable, and I think this is due to the difference in simulation quality. In other words, if you get good in Eleven, you'll suck in this one and viceversa.

Last point: Cost. Eleven is chaper.

It needs another level or two of bots, perhaps greater variation of styles, just four AI players with upgraded capabilities and skins. review_title: Easy to play but hard to master
one_reviews_text: I've tried several table tennis games.  Since I'm not good at table tennis in real, some were too realistic and hard to play.  But some were too arcade so didn't feel like playing actual sports.  I think this game is just in between.  Arcade mode is really good for new comers like me.  After some experience, I started to play simulation mode and it's still hard but enough to manage.  Fantastic graphics, great sound, reasonable physics.  What more can I ask?...
Excellent game, the developers are listening and improving it with every update.
best table tennis game I've played but needs cross-progression between Quest and Rift S being this game is cross-buy

The physics are amazing. It really feels like you are standing in front of a real table tennis table. A friend of me played it and when he made a pause he wanted to put the racket on the table ;D So - very immersive - multiplayer enabled!

Gooood job guys! Also the crossbuy is perfect!

I played the latest version of the game on my Oculus Rift today and I'm pretty impressed. It runs very smoothly and the tracking works fine. The physics (simulation) seems to be better compared to an older version I played. The new scenario in the sports hall is also very nice and fits best to the topic table tennis. So I give you 5 stars for the great work.

Five stars is something that needs no improvement.  I work for a major software company and have also worked for small start ups.  I know the difficulty of creating truly great software.  

I am not a pro table tennis player.  I have purchased numerous custom paddles and played against very, very good players.  I wouldn't say great because they don't do it for a living. 

Anyway, I love this game and play it daily for about twenty minutes.  I have only gotten through about two thirds of the robot ladder because I am a little stuck.  I have this robot's number sometimes and just fail to follow through.  Other times I just don't have it.  This is the type of stuff I live for.  It's a lot of fun and sometimes aggrevation for twenty minutes between doing something I need/have to do.

This is my first review and the reason for writing this is because there was an update to this game that made it unusable for me.  I looked up the email address of the company and let them know the specifics.  WIthin a half hour a got an email response and within three hours Oculus had an update that fixed the problem.

It turns out this "company" is one dude.  My hats off to him.  Anyone who thinks they can do better with just one person, I want to see that game (table tennis or whatever)

**  I forgot to mention **
As an update, I forgot to mention that during the three hour "outage" I experienced with this game, I took that opportunity to purchase "eleven table tennis" because I had an itch to play.  That was a really bad mistake for me.  I have a beefy computer and video card, but the game played very choppy.  The deal breaker was that the table was knee level and I couldn't find a way to reposition it.  I exited the app and started again, same thing.  I requested a refund after a total of three minutes.  Others don't seem to have this problem, so I can only speak for myself

I was really looking forward to this game and its VERY fun when it works. I haven’t had a single multiplayer game where it doesn’t glitch. Each player will see something different on their side. I’ll hit it to the left, see them miss, and it’ll teleport to their paddle and hit back when I wasnt expecting it, thinking I won the round. Also, there are very few people online. I wonder why.
review_feedback:
Hello,
next update should fix all online issues. Sorry for the problems!

one_reviews_text: As real as I think it is possible.

UPDATE: Still getting the multiplayer bug with opponent paddle angle not displaying correctly with the latest update, thanks for adding table color.  Will check back in a week or two.  

To get the big one out of the way and the reason for the (hopefully) temporarily low rating, multiplayer has a game-breaking bug atm where your opponent's paddle position is not correctly displayed.  Since I purchased this for the multiplayer, until this is fixed there really isn't any game here for me at all.  As a side note, the multiplayer is also dead in terms of # of players, no one is playing.  So if/when they fix the MP, be sure you have a friend to play with if you are expecting matches.

Regarding the rest of the game, polish/presentation is fine, nice touch with all the different AI's to play against in the championship mode.  Also has a training mode but it doesn't explain what the stats do, so I have no idea how to use it.  Physics is fine.  There is no option to use a real table tennis colored table however, hopefully they add this.  Devs seem active so I think this will continue to improve.

The bottom line is that if you are 100% only interested in single player table tennis VS AI, then both Eleven and Racket Fury are similar enough that I'd say just get whichever one is on sale/cheaper.  If you have any interest in multiplayer, then Eleven is the game to get.

I love to play table tennis.

Unfortunately, I almost never come to it.

The game creates incredibly authentic rallies.
I can play almost like in nature.
The only thing that annoys me is the cable from the Rift S. Probably I'll buy a quest for this game alone.

Update: With the latest update, still experiencing the multiplayer bug where it looks like the opponent is hitting the ball with the edge of their paddle (I'm playing in the same room with them IRL, even when they hit the ball flat-faced in their game it looks like the very side/edge in my game, and vice-versa).  Devs seem responsive though, hopefully this gets worked out.  Thanks for adding real table color.

Like the other reviewer, purchased this exclusively to play multiplayer, but it is bugged right now.  Dev has said they will look into it so I'll check back to see if they got it working.

one_reviews_text: Personnally I liked it far better then Eleven. The A.I. Opponents are quite funny and challenging to play against at the beginning.
Physics are for sure not as good as Eleven Table Tennis. Multiplayer is kinda broken. My friend and I seem to see two different things sometimes and it just randomly assigns points.

This game is really fun and well-polished! It's a bit difficult at first, but don't let that discourage you! After a few matches, you notice that you keep getting better at it. The game has all the game modes you could need (practice, tournament and multiplayer). The practice mode even allows you to change all the parameters of your opponent on the fly.
This game is now my #2 favorite after Beat Saber.

Excellent table tennis game. Physics and AI are great in simulation mode. I really feel like I am playing the table tennis and the same mistakes I do in real life happen here to. I find the physics  to be much better than 'Eleven' and the AI 
 feels like you are playing against professional players. I can play this game for hours on end. Multiplayer seems to be working great provided you have a good ping time!

This game has just everything a gamer ping pong player could wish for. The most amazing part of it is that Arcade mode which is a perfect balance between the help and make you feel you still have to perform and nail those smashes and blocks!! Wow I have a ping pong table at home and I'm not sure which is more fun to play with!!! The special effects can be removed but I say leave them their they will trigger reflexes in you you didn't know you had!!!  BTW can a Dev tel me if the game could possibly be too sensible when it comes to the return of a serve when the ball will have its second bounce on the table... we have this issue where we miss and we are not sure if its cause by a double ball bounce or the racket touching the table...  Our eye just can't catch the right explanation to it. Anyways we are having a blast every day in that game me and a friend (US Eastern server) Join us Everyone!

review_title: This could be the industry leader.
one_reviews_text: This might very well be the best table tennis app. out there, well, unless Rockstar decides to port over its classic game.  The spin, the smash-effects, the practice mode.  Like many other people who commented, the only last stage that is needed is multiplayer, which is "coming soon."
review_feedback: Racket Fury long-awaited multiplayer update has just arrived! We hope you'll enjoy it :)

review_title: You're missing out. This one is amazing!
one_reviews_text:
This game is amazing. It took me a few games to get my settings where they felt most natural. Once I did, it made it that much better. I play table tennis almost daily through the week. This game feels really, really close. I tried Eleven out on a free weekend. It was great, but I don't feel like it felt as good as this one.

If you're on the fence about this game, I would give it a chance. I'd love to have some players online and in-game. That is the only criticism - this game shines in multiplayer, but there aren't very many players, in any region. I wish there was a bigger player base. Perhaps, Steam queues are bigger.

Add me as a friend in Oculus and let's play!

review_title: Just get it for friends and YOU
one_reviews_text: Blow the minds of people who havent tried VR yet with a game everyone already knows how to play. So simple loads so fast.

review_title: Best Physics Around for Table Tennis
one_reviews_text: Multiplayer is here, and a fine table tennis simulator is complete.  Racket Fury remains the best performing, finest looking, and most accurate table tennis game around.  It performs well, and feels like I'm accurately playing the game.  Mind you, I'm no pro; perhaps there may be professionals out there who will need the vapors after reading my blasphemy, but from a sometime table tennis amateur, I gotta say it: this feels right.  And if accuracy isn't your thing, there's an arcade mode to keep it simple.  The robots you play against are the right balance of challenging to keep it fun, and keep me coming back for more.  Only one minor issue at the moment: nobody else was playing.  At least tonight (a Tuesday evening).  They have a nice option to search for players in the background while you practice against robots; no standing around doing nothing while you wait.  Hopefully the waiting won't be long for long.  Seriously, check this one out.  I've tried Eleven, and while they've made great strides with their physics, it still doesn't hold a candle to the accuracy here, nor does it perform anywhere near as well.  It's well worth the price.
review_feedback: Thank you for such a great review!

review_title: Game is good but customer service suck
one_reviews_text:
Good dAY!  I bought this game in the Oculus Store even though I already have the game in Steam just so i can give feedback to the dev/customer service.  As with the title, the game is actually good, however, the dev/customer service sucks big time.  I contacted them and asked that since i already bought this game on Steam, can i instead transfer the key to the Oculus Store.  No response at all.  Now I know it's not their fault that I bought this game on a different platform instead of waiting it to be available in the Oculus Store.  Having said that, I do know of other games that I bought on other platforms and then became available later in the Occ Store and when I contacted the devs and explained my case, they did give me a key to transfer it to Oculus Home.  Hopefully when i refund this game this review will not disappear.

P.S.  I hate running Steam in the background just to play a VR game.  I stopped purchasing Steam VR games a long time ago after some bad experiences.

***EDIT 2019Mar05***  It was great for the developer to reach out to me and provide me with the key.  I actually haven't used the key yet as I already bought my own way before this free key was given.  Regardless, I appreciate the gesture.  Hence I am upgrading my rating for this game.

review_feedback: Racket Fury long-awaited multiplayer update has just arrived!

one_reviews_text: Awesome game, note that I don't care for multiplayer and only tested singleplayer. Graphics are nice and works in 90 fps using super sampling 2.0 on a GTX 1080 (forced by Oculus Tray tool) - but 90 fps only works when selecting the two other scenes/environments than the default one (GTX 1080 Ti and RTX 2080 owners may not experience this problem ;-) Especially the scene with the large planets taxes the video card the least. I paid just 7.5 bucks for this game - it simply feels like getting table tennis at home - but I can play against cool and different robots! The game quickly gets challenging, there's great fun for both beginners and advanced players. Physics effects are awesome - it feels like real gravity on the ball. Note that I used 360 degrees tracking, it may be important in this game. I experienced no problems hitting the ball, tracking was simply excellent - sound effects weren't too loud but perfect. For the price this game is a steal, you won't find better table tennis on the Rift for less than 10 bucks - if at all. Don't miss out on trying this gem: in the rare case that you don't like it, you can always get a refund.
review_feedback: Thank you for review! :)

one_reviews_text: Feels like Table Tennis but somehow hits aren't registered sometimes and the game is so loud (crowd especially) I had to turn it down to 0 because no matter how quiet the game is in Windows or in the game settings its still too loud. Otherwise pretty nice game

I was glad to see you can adjust the angle you hold the paddle, the default setting did not line up with the touch controls at all.  I'd like to see more human opponents instead of just the floating robots but all in all i'm pretty happy with this it really feels like ping pong.

Its been forever since ive playued ping pong and as I got older (and graduated college) it got harder to find people to play with casually. Always been skeptical on vr ping pong games as I just felt they wouldnt give off that feeling like youre really playing. I took a dive on this since it was on sale and omg am I beyond happy with it. Its a very basic game from what ive played (which isnt much) but it absolutely nails the physics. The sound and feel is just spot on. Controls vibrate so well that it feels like you are actually holding a paddle and hitting a ball, its crazy. Love that the ball shows the spin you put on it as you hit it. Serving is really difficult for me so far but itll get better as I play. Def check this out if you want a casual pong game, wont be dissappointed
is there a timeline or trello board somewhere? i got the game regardless but this would def bee 5 star with some pvp
review_feedback: Racket Fury long-awaited multiplayer update has just arrived! We hope you'll enjoy it, and consider changing your review :)

one_reviews_text:
Gameplay feels fantastic, good practice mode to train on weak points.
The AI is well done, but this game would be twice as great with an online option.
There are lots of settings to tweak the sim, only wished there would be a way to dim the glowing white or orange ball a bit.

There are annoying glitches, that need to be addressed:
-- The game like to crash a lot.

--I only got a 2 sensor config, it seems sometimes the backhand side isn't captured properly and it happens that balls went through the paddle.

--When AI opponents serve, sometimes they drop the ball under the table and the match comes to an end, nothing happens there is no other option then aborting the match, very annoying at the 3rd set or in tournament.
Still no multiplayer!? Did they forget about us? I would give 5 stars if it had multiplayer. Eleven table tennis has online mode. If that is what you are looking for then it is worth the 20$

one_reviews_text: The gameplay feels "right", you use the same body and handmovements that you use in real life table tennis. I liked how you can costumize every detail (position of the racket, weight and bounciness of the ball, position of the table, etc). Also there is a ton of AI difficulties so you can pick the one that will really give you a challenge. Multiplayer would be nice but you can definitely have a lot of fun with this game in singleplayer.

one_reviews_text: I love table tennis - this game plays as you would expect if you're experienced with the sport. Graphics are good and physics are very realistic.

review_title: Loads of Fun and Exercise Too
one_reviews_text: This was on sale so I picked it up after playing Eleven Tennis and enjoying it so much during the free weekend.  The ping pong play here is fun in both the arcade and simulation modes.  I've won games in championship levels in both, but win or lose its just all out fun playing the AIs in this game.
It's an excellent table tennis game, I find the sensations of a real match in pro mode. The AI reacts well but I can't wait to play multiplayer with real players.

I like it. I haven't played table tennis in a while, so my memory may not be 100% accurate with regards to physics, but they seemed fine to me. There's definitely something wrong with the paddle alignment though. Tweaking it is also hard due to sensitivity. I am keeping this game over the other one so many people compare it to. What I'd really like to see in the game:
1) Paddle level. Just copy Eleven Tennis, they did it correctly.
2) Multiplayer.
3) Music while in game, not just the menu screen.
4) The ball should bounce off the robot if you hit him. They should also react to being hit. This would be such a neat touch to the game and would make people feel better when they are losing.

Edit: It seems that volume controls are not working. That crowd cheering is extremely annoying and I can't disable it...

its table tennis (VR) at its best . there is an arcade mode that turns you into a pro which is great fun. The real mode has a steeper learning curve  which is doubly fun.  Missing multi player support .

I got this during a flash sale, it was an offer I couldn't refuse. I wasn't expecting much however was pleasantly surprised at how fun it was. I tried the "real physics" version and it wasn't fun, I suck IRL but also I don't think the physics were the best either. I tried bouncing the ball up and down on my paddle and it just felt and looked weird. No, where this game shines is in the arcade mode. Just whack away at the ball against difficult (and taunting) AI robot opponents. The action is fast paced and intense. It gave me a workout! I give it 4 stars mainly because some opponents are very difficult--- a little too difficult. They move so fast, they basically teleport to the ball at times. The only way to win is to have them make a mistake which I guess is programmed into their behavior. If you practice with them, they make no mistakes. Still loads of fun though. I don't get upset when I lose, it just makes me want to play more. Don't throw your controllers folks!

I've only played practice in arcade mode  - this was great and took me back to my youth when I played a lot of table tennis. I look forward to playing a more  realistic game but either way this is well worth buying for both beginners or someone like me,  returning to enjoy the sport.  Highly recommended and a very reasonable price for the amount of work that it must have taken to produce such a polished game.

review_title: Sorry but for me physics are off
one_reviews_text: I can only compare this to Eleven Table Tennis. For me, that game just feels natural. This game, the physics of how the ball comes off the paddle just doesn't feel nearly as natural. It doesn't feel like real life. I realize nothing will for now, but this is just a step below Eleven. As an arcady type game though, its not bad and may appeal more to others. Something about the way the forehand feels for me is just not right with how I hold the paddle. I tried adjusting the different selections, but I just couldn't get the right feel. With Eleven, I didn't have to tweak anything. As soon as I picked up the paddle it felt natural. Unfortunately, I waited too long for the refund even though I played less than 2 hours, but still happy to donate to the devs to support VR.

review_title: If u could Attach a Tracker to a Paddle.
one_reviews_text: Wonderful physics in this game. Once this works with a TRACKER attached to a REAL PADDLE, this will be one of the best VR games out there. Are they using trackers with this game on VIVE yet?  When is Oculus going to release TRACKERS?!! That'll be a game change. Keep up the good work!

*** EDIT FOR DEV - Ball passing through paddle on simulation mode (forehand shots using a left hand) Sudden drops to 45FPS - Must we go through the table adjutment tutorial everytime i play a game? No muliplayer in Oculus Home , although MP is avialable in steam though.**** I chose this over Eleven after playing both .  For me the fun experince of this and the physics shone through. It's a trueLy superb simualtion thats fun and easy to pick up even if you haven;t played Ping Pong before, its addictive! However as mentioned these bugs fixed and maybe more content.

Hiya there! 

Short version:
If you want a true to life simulation to this game, buy Racket Fury. If you want a casual/more arcadey game, either Racket Fury or Eleven are great buys. 

Long version: 
For those looking for a realistic table tennis game...look no further! Seriously...just before buying this, I bought Eleven (another table tennis game). At first the Eleven game was mindblowing. I couldn't believe how realistic the game was but I found a serious flaw with Eleven. The forehand's spin mechanic is completely broken b/c it is as if the forehand rubber was anti-spin rubber. Also, the AI in Eleven was not good at all. After some research, I found that this game: Racket Fury is SO CLOSE TO REAL LIFE! At first I blew this game off after watching the trailer but I realized that the trailer shows the Arcadey Mode and not the hyper-realistic full simulation mode. I bought it, I don't regret it, buy it. Everything about this game was done right. This will be a great training tool for serious players. I don't train as often with my bestfriend due to travel distance, so this is a great game to use when I want to train whenever I want.  
 :)
Tons of fun facing off against the challenging AI. No multiplayer mode yet but it's in the works.

I'm not a great player but I'm not bad.  I had a ping pong table growing up and I logged a lot of hours on that thing.

I haven't played meatspace table tennis in 20 years, so I had to give it a shot in VR since the reviews for Racket Fury and Eleven have been so good lately.

Guys, it's legit, it really is.  It's so fun.  After several minutes, all my muscle memory came back to me from playing when I was younger.  I made the same good shots I used to make.  But also the same bad ones too, especially when switching from backhand to forehand and dumping the ball into the net.  I did this so often when playing on a real table and it was no different with Racket Fury.

I had forgotten how much rhythm, concentration, and focus there is to table tennis and I lost myself in immersion during long rallies.   Playing this in VR is utterly engrossing.  The sights, sounds, and feel in the game are really good.  Table tennis really lends itself well to VR.

But make sure you have some room in your play space, this game requires about the same amount of space you would need for a meatspace table.

And you'll sweat too.  Running a GTX1060 (6 GB) and the game runs great.
Admittedly I havent tried any of the other VR table tennis offerings, but I am so impressed with this one that I don't feel the need to look any further.  Feels just like the real thing.

Amazing physics! I felt like I used to play during high schools. And what surprise me is that my gameplay is same as that of during high schools. Its better than the eleven tennis because the gameplay is fun too. Your difficulty level depends on the four kinds of robots you are dealing with. Recommended.

review_title: A must have for any VR library!
one_reviews_text:
Racket Fury is easy to pick up and quickly becomes more challenging when you encounter increasingly difficult opponents.
Unlike many other games, RF is casual, and you can easily fit in a quick game.
I don’t get VR sickness, but RF is just about as comfortable as they come.
What the game is missing:
Multiplayer,
Mini-games,
Achievements,
Any sort of narrative,

There are slew of small glitches, but for the price RF is a no-brainer.

Better than 'eleven', although this in part due to the fact that it's more forgiving (ie, easier). Being able to change the paddle angle is huge! I do wish there was an option to just show your oponent's paddle instead of the robot.

review_title: Legit physics simulation for ping pong.
one_reviews_text:
I used to play ping pong a lot, and I was quite surprised by how natural the gameplay is and how realistically the physics react in VR. 

Only downside is - no multiplayer, but the option for it is present in the menu, and says it is coming soon.

According to Steam it's got multiplayer, but here at Oculus it shows only Single.  imo, mp is a must.

Good①　For the most part the physics are solid. I move my arms just like I do when I actually play and for the most part the result is expected, but that's for the forehand.  Bad①　I use my backhand more than most players, and when using it there the collision doesn't seem right (like it bounces off the paddle way later than it should and just feels really laggy even with grip style set to backhand). I have to slow down my wrist/arm movements on backhands, effectively use it like my forehand, and it's OK.  

Bad②　Sometimes when putting completely vertical forehand topspin on it I get no detection - this happens to me almost 100%.  Ball just passes through.  If I tilt my forehand so the paddle is about at a 15 degree angle or more to the table it works perfect.

Bad③
The instant the ball leaves your paddle, if it's not going to land on the table, bots freeze up.  I don't like this.  A good part of the fun of table tennis is waiting to see if it's gonna land.  The bots know it isn't immediately, and that sucks.  

Kinda Bad④ You don't lose a point for missing your serve.  You should.  That would make it feel more like a simulation.  I know that it's possible to detect this. (The option to enable it might be there, but it should be on by default for simulation.)

All that aside, I'm amazed at how real this game feels.  It surprised me. I give it 3.5 stars.  

It's definitely worth the price they sell it for. If they fixed up the physics and collision detection just a little bit more, AND added MP I'd pay at least $30 for this no questions asked.

Only just got it, but from what I can see this is a really, really good game - having so much fun with it. Another fun game that makes you sweat!

Giving 4 stars as I haven't had it long enough to give 5, but will update in future if it still holds same opinion after a week or so.

Salute to the devs.
when will be play online
review_feedback: Racket Fury long-awaited multiplayer update has just arrived!

one_reviews_text:
Excellent gameplay and the only way I can fit a ping pong table in my house!  You can get pretty competitive playing against AI.  You have a lot of control over your shots, but it's still forgiving enough to account for limitations of VR/resolution and skill level. The spin indicator on the ball is helpful because without it, you'd have no way of knowing what kind of spin is on the ball.

Best part: Not having to retrieve balls from under a chair, table, or behind a desk. And not having to worry about your dog stealing the balls.

Worst part: Can't be used for beer pong.

For $10, this game is a steal.  The physics are brilliant.  I play table tennis a ton and I can tell you that playing this game is just like the real thing.  It took me a little bit to get the adjustments of the paddle angle and such perfect, but once I did, it made the world of difference.  Every shot I do in real life is the same here, even the bad shots. 

Only 4 stars because there's 1 major component missing and a couple tweaks to be made.  The major component missing is the ability to customize your paddle.  Most table tennis players will tell you that custom building your paddle makes all the difference in the world.  Given the sophistication of the physics in this game, I can't see why it would be difficult.  Then the game progression would improve as well.  Rather than buying parts for your character that you can't even see, you'll be able to upgrade and customize your paddle.  Hoping the developers can get that done.

Also, tweaking the settings is difficult with the sliders.  They're too senstive, so if I want to land on 76 degrees exactly for my paddle angle, it takes forever.  There should be an arrow that lets me make small adjustments without using motion to adjust the slider.

Overall - my favorite VR game to date and could be so much better.

Pros:
Very realistic, if you like tennis table, you will like this.
Cons: 
Missing multiplayer, says coming soon, hope soon means a week or two, the steam version has it.

Is there a way to redeem on steam?
review_feedback: Racket Fury long-awaited multiplayer update has just arrived, it took a little bit longer than one or two weeks - but we hope it was worth waiting!

one_reviews_text:
Experienced amateur TT player here.  This really compelling and exceeded my expectations for realism and fun.  The simulation mode feels 75% like real table tennis.  Nitpicks with the physics aside, this is one of my favorite VR games and so I'm giving it 5 stars.

Nitpick with spin :
Even with spin at 100, the ball doesn't curve in the air enough on low speed shots, nor does spin affect the table bounce as much as it should.

Other things:  
It would be nice to have a visible audience that cheers during good points.  
It's uncanny when the opponent stands motionless when I hit the ball long;  consider an animation like backing up slowly.
review_feedback: Thank you for your valuable feedback. We'll definitely consider adding audience and commentary to the game to make the experience even more realistic.

one_reviews_text: Amazing game...realistic...
This game is addictive, feels like I'm actually playing ping pong.

Really good physics, sounds and feel. 
If you are looking for a realistic Table Tennis game and are trying to decide between Eleven and this game, choose this!

review_title: I was going to be a real table...
one_reviews_text: Wow! This is a fun game and whether you're playing arcade or full physics, you will have a good time. I started off playing the full physics and I was surprised at how real it felt, a slight twist in your wrist and the ball spins the way you intend it. I was able to serve 6 feet away from the table and slice the ball past the oppenent. The only downside is that the Rift got sweaty quickly. :D
It is really like playing real table tennis. I am amazed. Super smooth playing very nice physics and good graphics. A must have !

It is okay but Eleven: Table Tennis VR is better. The environment is more relaxing in Eleven and there plays nice music, and the physics and the opponent are very good in Eleven as well. What I miss is some music while playing a game. The music theme of the menu would be already fine. And an option of course to switch the music on or off for those who want it, or not, during a game. The essagerate way the robots move their arms while playing is very irritating, looks like they play tennis, not table tennis. Other then that it is a good Table Tennis, but the missing ingame music is a pity and the swing of the bots is irritating. If only there would be a bit of music while playing so you have a nice flow I would raise the stars to four - maybe the devs can implement that as the music theme is already there. Thx!

Since i've played with this simulation, i'm telling to all my friends how perfect table tennis fits to vr.

I didn't play real table tennis very often in the past, since i make this annoying mistakes with my forehand. In this simulation, i make this also, because, this is a very very good sim.
Now i can train my faults and get better without any real partner....in my room!

I don't know wether i become a fan of real table tennis becaus i'm very untalented, but one thing i know: this is a great simulation and a milestone for vr sport games!!

This was absolutly incredible! The feel of playing was so real that it brought back childhood memories. It was astonishing to see the robot counterparts get angry  and annoyed at their plays. 5 Stars absolutly!

Why do i have to keep doing the turotorial every time i start a new game? why does the ball never return to my hand & stay on the floor all the time? you need to fix the bugs & give more options. Also.. why does the calibration have to be so annoying? in eleven table tennis you can just hold down 1 button and move the table around, why the whole show & holding down 30 buttons for one direction in this game?
review_feedback:
Hello,
the tutorial only shows up when you play against the first opponent in the first cup. In the tutorial you can see that you have to pull the ball with the trigger. Table callibration can be improved, but we didn't hear about any bugs because we spent a long time in Early Access making sure that the game will be perfect when we release full. We hope when you play a little bit more you will consider changing your review :-)

review_title: Great game but needs some adjustments.
one_reviews_text:
Great game, when it gets online it will be even better, and for its price its a steal. One of few games you dont get bored of and can jump in at any time. No nausea. TT is the perfect match for VR.

But,

I feel the ball bounces too hard/fast.
The jump to terra knox might be to steep as i breezed through the other but am unable to get a set from him.
The AI is to varied, sometimes they hit/miss very loose balls sometimes they smash so hard you are unable to react on a low good serve/hit at the edge.
I have never gotten an edge hit or net roller seems these are not in the game, which is sad.
It seems to only register clean hits on the racket. if you are more then a bit off the ball fly through the racket which kills the imersion.

Great game. I find the robot opponents to be extremely irritating after a while, and am not a fan of seeing them teleport from one place to another. Would also like to see the ai at least consider going for the ball instead of just floating there motionless even though it already knows my return is going to miss the table the second my paddle strikes the ball. Would make the immersion a bit fuller.

Awesome simulation. Hope your can fix some animations in the oponents which make them easier to beat in the next serve.

I enjoyed this title most than anyother so far.
This game is pretty realistic, my husband played for about an hour. Good excersice.

If you like table tennis you must get this game.
If you don't like table tennis then you should absolutely get this game.
Just go get this game. Duh!
Fantastic simulation!! Well done and congrats to devs :)
This is quite an achievement. I lost 10 pounds in one week just playing this game every night.

Wow, just wow. I've come back from playing this for 3 hours without realising the time had flown. This is quite possibly the most immersive VR game I've played on the Rift so far, given that the Touch controllers literally feel like bats in your hand. I love playing table tennis in real life, so the physics here are spot-on. I'm able to perform all the sort of serves and slices I normally would in real life and even end up holding the controller in the same way I hold a bat. The AI characters have fun personalities and I've exclaimed "Nice shot!" a few times when they get a good one by me. It's saying something that I forget they don't exist! Great job devs!

I bought this for the discounted price of £5.99, but I would have happily paid double that for what is a very good sim experience. I'm a pretty good table tennis player in real life and can say that the simulation game feels about as good as one can expect. I've not tried the arcade game, but I've no interest in it.

I'm still struggling to settle on a natural bat angle setting, this is no fault of the game (the option is there) but I doubt I'll ever get it 100% right because as good as the Touch controller is, it doesn't feel quite right in my hand compared to a real bat. The ball physics are very good, albeit not perfect - the ball does seem to slide ever so slightly and is also that bit too bouncy when rolling it around/bouncing it on the bat, but I'm not sure if this strange act is transferred onto actual gameplay in any way. To be honest, if the haptics were stronger (I have it set to max), the sensation of hitting the ball would be almost lifelike. 

The AI is more than able to put up a decent challenge; I've managed to 3 star all the 'Rusty' and 'Plastic' games, but 'Gold' is now a proper challenge, only 2 starring the first two bots and not able to beat Tera Knox...yet! Hopefully the devs will achieve good online gameplay, that is where the real fun should be. At this point, though, and again for the low price, it's an easy 5/5 recommendation to all who enjoy a bit of table tennis, novice or expert.
Only con is the sound of the audience cheering is too loud and I can't reduce it, only on/off option. Other then that great game. Buy it!
Even if you don't play online, the in-game bots alone are amazing and absolutely worth it! £2.99 is a Mcdonalds burger; i think this is a real bargain!

I played my fair share of table tennis as a kid and I'm re-discovering the pleasing adrenaline rush of intense games. If you ever played TT for sport your body will remember the posture and moves and this game will be your favorite workout for a while. Cannot wait to see online play implemented...

I play a lot of table tennis and I realy enjoy playing this game.  It acts as a good practice session and it feels like I am really playing.

I have got up to Semi pro 3 (level 13) and at this level its really a good challenge.  And this level is only 1/3 through the third championship out of 4. So there is plenty left for me to do.

There are a few niggles - it likes strokes to be quite obvious and my default serve is a bit more brushy which it doesnt like, but that is OK.

Really really pleased that this game exists and Im really enjoying playing it

I really enjoyed this game - I'm only a casual table tennis player but enjoy playing it every now and then. This game gives me even more passion for it - really fun, seems to play accurately and a workout too! Definitely worth the asking price.
Very good simulation, only hoping for multiplayer to be added down the line (it says coming soon)
review_feedback: Racket Fury long-awaited multiplayer update has just arrived!

one_reviews_text: One of the most addictive vr games opponents are chellenging but not too fustrating, makes you want to come back and try one more time to beat them. Have acctually become better at real table tennis after playing this

I've downloaded many VR games for my Oculus, but this is actually one of my favorite games.  The physics are very, very good, so it feels like you're really playing ping-pong.  I wouldn't be surprised at all to see playing this transfer over to getting better at playing real ping-pong.  It's an addictive game, well priced, and well done.  I'm looking forward to when they open it up for online play.  Great game.

review_title: Great game but a little bit too empty
one_reviews_text:
This game has a serious lack of content. When I launched the game I even thought I bought a pre-alpha version (but it is 1.5 version right now!). On top of that, there is no multiplayer yet.
Whatever, the physics are pretty realistic and the render is good.

review_title: You can sell your ping pong table
one_reviews_text: For the money, you won't find a better VR sports game.  There are 2 modes, Simulator and Arcade.  Simulator is very realistic and actually feels like your playing real ping pong.  Arcade mode subtley helps you so you don't have to be as precise, which frees you up to hit the ball hard and add spin easily.  There are some bugs and multiplayer is not yet available, but I hope the developers will get these ironed out.  Great game overall.

I have Eleven also which is also good but think i prefer this simply because i seem to have better games against the Ai. I didn't think i would like the enviroments but they work pretty well, i just wish there was more of them. Lots of options to set things up, i didn't play arcade version yet just the more realistic version. I'm not great at ping pong but i enjoy this game.

I've played a lot of Eleven but this game walks all over it. There is something about feeling like you actually hit the ball here you feel it. 

Love it, and wish my friends were now robots haha
Never thought VR could emulate playing sport experience this good.
This game is so good. I smashed that ping pong ball so hard that it threw me off balance and I fell right on my face and almost broke my nose. Need I say more?

I am a huge fan of pingpong, and I do play it seriously on the real world. This game simulates the real pingpong really well. Because of Oculus Touch controller, I think this game is better with shake-hand style. Sorry pen-holder players! You still need to calibrate the angle a little bit, but after the calibration, it's really fun! I finally found my workout game!

I believe I'll get better at real table tennis because of this. Awesome job. Must have! I can't wait for multiplayer. I'm having some problems tho. The bloody audience volume is so high it is going to damage my ears and it can't be turned down. Aswell as the app crashing in the start. It crashes when I realase the ball.

This is an absolute blast!  And a light workout as well.  The controls just feel so natural.  I didn't want to stop playing, but I had to stop and write this review.  This will likely be the thing I use to demo VR for people now.  The controls are so intuitive.  It really feels like playing ping-pong.  Buy it!

This is a review of the simulation mode:

I'm an avid table tennis player, and to be fair, really didn't expect much from this title, I was surprised, it was WAY better than expected. It needs work to be a viable practice bot, but I really think with some work they could actually get it there.

Overal play was smooth and I didn't feel any overt response problems.

Here is what I hope they can tune up:

The paddle feel is pretty far off. Mostly I think it's because you can't dial in dwell time or trampolene effect so you can't get it to feel like a real paddle.

When the ball is moving fast, it strobes, not much worse than playing under fluorescent lights however. It does make it difficult to follow the ball into the paddle.

When the paddle is moving fast is strobes massivly and is distracting if you glance at it.

The biggest problem is that you can't attack agressivly since the paddle swings through the ball missing it.

So, why 4 stars?  This is an amazing attempt. Way better than I expected it could be. It's super playable and fun.

I'll be keeping it and looking forward to updates! Kudos to the developers for this!

A big thanks the reviewers that convinced me to buy this one. There were not exaggerating: Pure Fun, Pure Physics, Real and Natural! You won't believe how real it plays even on the arcade mode! Also the graphics, sound and the presentation of the menus etc have this arcade, fast paced feeling that put you into the action as fast as possible. A great game -finally- after Robo Recall!

This is a joy to play. I really felt immersed in the environment. Make sure you have a good amount of space because when you really get into it, things can get broken. All it needs now is a online multiplayer component, voice chat and an audience.

You can believe the 5 star reviews, this game is legit.  I don't even play ping pong in real life, yet I'm having tons of fun playing this game.  It feels good, from the physics, to the visuals, to the reflex timing.  It all comes together for a pleasant, yet challenging experience.  I didn't think I could properly serve after my first match.  Started my second match, and I was serving perfectly each time (not the best serve, but I was not faulting or losing points on serve).  I lost my first match against the AI in arcade mode and only scored 4 total points.  I beat the AI in my second match in only 2 sets.  Definitely felt like when I lost a point it was due to my error and that I had control over my own performance.  That's quite the exhilirating experience and one that many sports VR titles do not get right.  You have total control over the outcome.  And most of it is mental, because you do get lots of assists in arcade mode to make it an easier game for a noob at table tennis like me.  Even more amazing is that I was doing it with only front facing sensors and basically only standing room.  Rating 9/10 (assuming multiplayer gets here quickly)
Feels like i have a table tennis court in my room! Physics are amazing!

This game is just awesome. I don't like table tennis normaly because im just not good at it, but this is just fun and challenging at the same. I love the way, that i don't need to go pick up the ball every time i missed him :D

(But it would be even more awesome, if you can throw your bat)

Wow the game is great the inmersion is amazing I was even talking to the robbot lol, and for this price? everyone you have to buy this amazing game and multiplayer is coming soon just amazing love is im sweating here... GG

Really amazing how accurate you are hitting the ball and how good the game feeling is. I am really amazed by that. Besides that it is a lovely nice table tennis game with multiplayer being added later. For that price definitly a must have in your VR gallery.

review_title: i play and this is perfect
one_reviews_text: best simulation so far

Really enjoying this used to play a lot and very close to reality looking forward to multiplayer only issue i keep pressing the occulus button on my right hand and keep comeing out of game any one else have issues with this . Worth every penny and reasonably priced.

super game but from the third level of "simulation", the controller oculus does not seem to be able touch the ball very often (specially  at the service of the robot) ; the problem does not exist in the arcade mode;

First actual purchase of a VR game which is worth every penny and then some.  Just a fantastic game that you can play for hours on end without any discomfort whatsoever.  If you enjoy ping pong you will love this VR version, highly recommended.
Just playing arcade mode at the moment but this is lots of fun and feels great. I need to get the angle of the bat sorted for my forehand topspin, but the options are there for me to do it.

review_title: The best VR game right now.
one_reviews_text:
Amazing physics, and the most fun you can have with your headset on. The practice mode alone makes this game a must have.
I've lost many many hours just seeing how long a rally I can achieve.
This is a bargain and one of the best games on the store.
This makes VR worth it! Great table tennis simulation

Supported this in early access on steam, noticed a small issue on the oculus version regarding no haptic feedback. this worked well on the steam version. hopefully this gets patched. Update!! (that was quick, haptic feedback issue fixed in latest patch)
review_feedback: Perfect! We're glad you like it! :-)

one_reviews_text: The first four opponents are a breeze then the difficulty spikes dramatically. Good,well made game and I'm having fun with it, but I just can never play past "Rusty" level.
Really nice. Worth every cent.  Realistic and fun!
Pretty good fun

wasnt expecting much from this but was plesantly surprised. Physics are awesome, colour pallet excelent and some great AI lead to more fun than i thought possible with table tennis. Just get that multiplayer sorted and its a 5 star.

This game is extremely entertaining. While the physics don't feel 100%, they are very close. There are some minor bugs and translation issues here and there, but the price outweighs all of these. Definitely reccomend.

It's basically the best VR game your money can buy these days.
Nothing more than rookie in real life, so I can't say how much it's phisically accurate, but it is really A LOT of fun.
just needs multiplayer , best ping pong game out there
The whole game and the operation feel so natural that you can dive into it in no time at all.
Updating review to 2 stars. Ive had this game since release late last year, and while multiplayer was promised, there have been no updates since. Still waiting....
I thod you can't spin but then I discovered in setting that you have to turn,this game is so real.
addictive and helps technique

Love the realitstic physics.

Not much makes me say "something is not right here" & I can't wait for online!
this is the best game, so much fun, so realistic that i find myself plying it for hours, this is a no brainer buy it
I bought this on a whim thinking it couldn't possibly be as good as the ratings, and I was blown away. I love it.
I'm sure there will be improvements to come and this game is already enjoyable. Feels very realistic.
So much fun and very realistic action. Multiplayer will be the cherry

It's a great!!
I love this game.
Thank you for creating it.
Really accurate. Hope the online play mode arrives soon!
4 star need online mod :(
Multiplayer will be sick as hell.
very good game almost perfect!!!
review_feedback: Great to hear! Thanks! :-)
